name: Angkor Wat
description: The largest religious monument in the world, Angkor Wat is renowned for its stunning architecture and intricate bas-reliefs depicting Hindu mythology.

name: Bayon Temple
description: Famous for its massive stone faces, Bayon Temple offers a unique glimpse into the Khmer Empire with its intricate carvings and sprawling complex.

name: Ta Prohm
description: Known for the giant trees and ruins intertwined, Ta Prohm provides a mesmerizing atmosphere that showcases nature's reclamation of history.

name: Phnom Penh Royal Palace
description: The Royal Palace is a stunning example of Khmer architecture and serves as the residence of the King of Cambodia, featuring ornate buildings and beautiful gardens.

name: Silver Pagoda
description: Part of the Royal Palace complex, the Silver Pagoda is famed for its silver-tiled floor and houses a collection of priceless Buddhist artifacts.

name: Killing Fields of Choeung Ek
description: A poignant memorial to the victims of the Khmer Rouge regime, the Killing Fields offer a somber reflection on Cambodia's tragic history.

name: Tuol Sleng Genocide Museum
description: Once a high school turned into a prison, this museum provides a harrowing insight into the atrocities of the Khmer Rouge.

name: Bokor National Park
description: Home to lush rainforests, waterfalls, and the abandoned Bokor Hill Station, this national park offers stunning views and a serene escape into nature.

name: Kampot River
description: The picturesque Kampot River is perfect for boat tours and kayaking, surrounded by stunning landscapes and charming riverside restaurants.

name: Phnom Kulen National Park
description: This national park is home to the sacred Kulen Mountain, known for its waterfalls, ancient temples, and as the birthplace of the Khmer Empire.

name: Sihanoukville Beaches
description: Famous for its beautiful sandy beaches and clear waters, Sihanoukville is a popular destination for relaxation, water sports, and vibrant nightlife.

name: Koh Rong
description: An idyllic island known for its pristine beaches and vibrant coral reefs, Koh Rong is perfect for snorkelling, diving, and enjoying nature's tranquility.

name: Battambang Bamboo Train
description: A unique mode of transport, the bamboo train allows visitors to experience the countryside while riding on a flatbed bamboo platform.

name: Rice Field Tours
description: Explore the rural lifestyle of Cambodia through guided tours of rice fields, where you can learn about traditional farming practices and local culture.

name: Preah Vihear Temple
description: Perched on a 600-meter cliff, this UNESCO World Heritage site offers breathtaking views and is a stunning example of Khmer architecture.

name: Koh Ker
description: Less visited than Angkor, Koh Ker features impressive ruins, including the pyramid-shaped temple of Prasat Thom, surrounded by dense jungle.

name: Banteay Srei
description: Known as the 'Citadel of Women,' Banteay Srei is famous for its stunningly detailed pink sandstone carvings, making it a must-visit for art lovers.

name: Tonle Sap Lake
description: The largest freshwater lake in Southeast Asia, Tonle Sap is home to floating villages and diverse wildlife, offering boat tours that showcase unique local culture.

name: Oudong
description: Once the capital of Cambodia, Oudong features a series of stupas on a hill, showcasing the country's royal heritage and offering panoramic views.

name: Prek Toal Bird Sanctuary
description: A vital habitat for various bird species, this sanctuary is perfect for birdwatching and experiencing the unique ecosystem of Tonle Sap.

name: Mekong River
description: The Mekong River is known for its beautiful sunsets and the rare Irrawaddy dolphins that inhabit its waters, making it a serene place to explore.

name: Phnom Penh Night Market
description: A bustling market offering local crafts, street food, and live music, the Phnom Penh Night Market is a vibrant experience of Cambodian culture.

name: Samatoa Textile School
description: This unique school teaches traditional silk weaving techniques while providing support to local artisans, offering visitors a chance to learn and shop.

name: Silk Island
description: A short boat ride from the city, Silk Island is known for its silk weaving, where visitors can witness the traditional process and purchase handmade products.

name: Koh Ta Kiev
description: A lesser-known island offering serene beaches and lush jungles, Koh Ta Kiev is ideal for those looking to escape the crowds and enjoy nature.

name: Sangkar River
description: The Sangkar River is perfect for boat tours, offering stunning views of rice paddies, traditional villages, and opportunities to see local wildlife.

name: Wat Phnom
description: This historic temple sits on a hill and is the tallest religious structure in the city, surrounded by lush gardens and bustling streets.

name: Chau Say Tevoda
description: A beautiful temple complex dedicated to the Hindu gods, Chau Say Tevoda features intricate carvings and is often less crowded than other sites.

name: NagaWorld
description: This entertainment complex combines a luxury hotel, casino, and numerous dining options, providing a vibrant nightlife experience in the capital.

name: Kampong Phluk
description: A floating village on Tonle Sap Lake, Kampong Phluk offers a glimpse into the unique lifestyle of its residents and the natural beauty of the area.

name: Banteay Samre
description: This lesser-known temple is admired for its well-preserved carvings and beautiful surroundings, providing a peaceful alternative to more popular sites.

name: Koh Norea
description: A hidden gem, Koh Norea offers serene landscapes and a chance to explore untouched nature away from the bustling city.

name: Kratie Riverfront
description: The riverfront area of Kratie is ideal for relaxing and enjoying the scenic views of the Mekong River and spotting the rare Irrawaddy dolphins.

name: Phnom Chisor
description: This ancient hilltop temple offers stunning views of the surrounding countryside and is a peaceful site often overlooked by tourists.

name: Sangha Retreat
description: A unique wellness retreat offering yoga and meditation, Sangha Retreat is set in a tranquil environment, perfect for relaxation and rejuvenation.

name: Koh Thmei
description: A quiet island known for its natural beauty and rich marine life, Koh Thmei is perfect for snorkeling and enjoying the pristine environment.

name: Cardamom Mountains
description: A remote area filled with rich biodiversity, the Cardamom Mountains are ideal for trekking and discovering the natural beauty of Cambodia.

name: Ream National Park
description: This coastal national park features mangroves, pristine beaches, and diverse wildlife, providing opportunities for hiking, birdwatching, and relaxation.

name: Wat Ounalom
description: One of the most important temples in Phnom Penh, Wat Ounalom is a center of Cambodian Buddhism and features stunning architecture and serene grounds.

name: Coconut Village
description: A cultural village showcasing traditional Khmer architecture and crafts, Coconut Village is a unique place to learn about Cambodian heritage.

name: Sangha Retreat
description: A wellness retreat offering yoga, meditation, and holistic treatments, Sangha Retreat is set in a stunning tropical paradise.

name: Bamboo Island
description: A tranquil island known for its crystal-clear waters and white sandy beaches, perfect for swimming and relaxation away from the crowds.

name: Wat Ek Phnom
description: This ancient temple features impressive ruins and serene surroundings, providing a glimpse into Cambodia's rich history.

name: Koh Pich
description: A popular entertainment hub with shopping, dining, and nightlife, Koh Pich offers a vibrant atmosphere for both locals and tourists.

name: Sangha Retreat
description: A unique wellness retreat offering yoga and meditation, Sangha Retreat is set in a tranquil environment, perfect for relaxation and rejuvenation.

name: Koh Ta Kiev
description: A lesser-known island offering serene beaches and lush jungles, Koh Ta Kiev is ideal for those looking to escape the crowds and enjoy nature.

name: Oudong
description: Once the capital of Cambodia, Oudong features a series of stupas on a hill, showcasing the country's royal heritage and offering panoramic views.

name: Bamboo Train
description: A unique mode of transport, the bamboo train allows visitors to experience the countryside while riding on a flatbed bamboo platform.

name: Tonle Sap Lake
description: The largest freshwater lake in Southeast Asia, Tonle Sap is home to floating villages and diverse wildlife, offering boat tours that showcase unique local culture.
